intro: Lapathum sinuatum, commonly known as the redstem sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. The plant has alternate, narrow leaves that are often slightly notched or serrated along the edges. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in dry, sandy or gravelly soils. Lapathum sinuatum is a low-growing perennial that thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant.
